comment.body: For emoticons i am using Firefox extension called Unicode Emoji. Mouse click the emoji and then Ctrl+V üéÇ
@klu9@zeroid.bit you're welcome üçÄ :-)

I see: "No peers found"
The "content publish failed" usually appear when zeronet can not find peers to publish your changes.
Solution is to [advertise your site](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1524949682_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) while keeping your zeronet running (ideally with also tor working so you reach more peers) for a few hours. You can also get peers by opening your site in proxy like https://0net.io
yes, the site is loading now for me
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: check it via proxy in the meantime: https://0net.io/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L
@Tusiko: and you can run your own [proxy](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:proxies) too
This blog has no database when i open its menu, so it is not a content management system, just a html static site. I would bet it is just a mirror from the clearnet.

Update is done by clicking zeronet version in the ZeroHello settings menu (three dots next to the logo). The site for movie.bit possibly exist, but we do not know its address - a reason why i think it is [not good idea to link to a .bit, but better to use/link to real address](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1516098717_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS).

I do not remember seeing anything else than "Up to date" on the Zeronet version menu entry. Isn|t there a bug? https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroHello/blob/9fe4d39b0145390d95d7c60503e1c2cd74a8eb05/js/all.js#L6673

.deb packages, systemd, good rating at https://distrowatch.com/table.php?distribution=deepin
Unsure if it is safe OS regarding privacy since it will be used by many people from China.
hi, no i can not see them, nor any text or download link. I see only an input field to add my comment, so i added it.
anyone see the torrent? i see only form fields...

i like Tribler, and will return to it from time to time once they implement features that i find necessary in order to use it. So far i am staying with [qbittorrent](https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent) + using [OpenVPN](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1548340010_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+setup+private+OpenVPN+on+a+Linux+server+and+Windows+Android+client) to hide my IP.
Thx for sharing this @Klu9, i watched this and also verifying my browser extensions. Removing unimportant ones and remaining checking for being open source & look trustable.

@klu : Let us know which extensions you find trustworthy and which not.

[here](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517335328_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Most+important+Firefox+extensions+addons) is my current list
@Realjohndoe: Small tiny box that does alot of things. if you setup that, certainly post here on zerome, looks interesting.

i do NOT see it and [0net.io proxy neither](https://0net.io/192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3/?Topic:49_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs/Diabolik+1968+Eng+Spa+Ita+x264+multisub)
When you update your post, does it publish to peers? The ZeroTorrent site on [ZeroHello](/) shows any failed/unpublished files related to your profile on that site? (some sites shows a bell kind of icon on ZeroHello sites list), details of failed files is shown inside ZeroTorrent site (0) menu on the bottom of the menu). In my case i do not see any update failed files. This do not seem like global problem of the ZeroTorrent, because i can see [other user submission](/192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3/?Topic:2_1J5uFzQBpLpoyTZfH28Fv8KrThShewrF2d/Blockchain+gouvernance+et+nergie+Thinkerview) without problem.. Another thing you can try is to Rebuild and reload site database? (it is also done from within mentioned site (0) menu).
It would be ideal if there is some way to discover why this happended so it can be prevented for other users in future.

if size is too big, better to mark large files [optional](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/content_json/#files_optional) in content.json. But if the size is made up by just .html files, i do not know if it can be reduced.
